title.narrative: POLICIES FOR CHILD PROTECTION

description.narrative: By 2016, National Congress, state and municipal governments in territories where UNICEF has a presence (urban centres and municipalities enrolled in UNICEF Seal in the Semi-arid and Amazon) are implementing plans, policies and programmes to promote and protect the rights of children and adolescents, aligned with the National Ten-year Plan, and sensitive to gender, race and ethnicity equity approaches., which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, National Child Rights Guarantee Systems (SGD) is strengthened at national and local level to ensure equitable realization of children's rights, including those living with disabilities, taking into account gender, race and ethnicity dimensions, with a focus on the Semiarid, Amazon and the prioritized urban centres.

related-activity.ref: 0540/A0/05/004 PCR 4. GROW UP FREE FROM VIOLENCE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, National Congress, state and municipal governments in territories where UNICEF has a presence (urban centres andmunicipalities enrolled in UNICEF Seal in the Semi-arid and Amazon) are implementing plans, policies and programmes to promote andprotect the rights of children and adolescents, aligned with the National Ten-year Plan, and sensitive to gender, race andethnicity equity approaches.

description.narrative: UNICEF advocated and supported the implementation of national and sub-national initiatives to protect lives of adolescents from homicides. Religious leaders integrating the Movement for Peace and Protection, supported by UNICEF, continued to raise awareness and disseminate the importance of registering children, especially those from the most excluded groups. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Percentage of municipalities participating in the Urban Centres Platform where UNICEF is active implementing plans to promote and protect the rights of girls and boys drawn up from an inter-sectoral perspective

baseline.value: PCU: 100% of the municipalities in which UNICEF is active drawing up municipal plans to protect the rights of children and adolescents, without incorporating the guidelines and strategic objectives of

target.value: 2016:Guidelines of the ten-year plan for promoting and protecting children's rights disseminated and integrated into at least 50% of the Municipal Plans of PCU taking into account ethnic, racial, gender an

actual.value: 2016:PCUTechnical support provided to PCU municipalities of Maceio (Alagoas) and Manaus (Amazonas) have been finalized. The intersectoral SINASE Plan on Juvenile Justice was finalized and submitted to approval by the competent authority. Fortaleza - Committee on the Reduction of Lethal Violence in Fort

title.narrative: Existence of a national plan for addressing homicides, with a focus on the death rate among black adolescents.

baseline.value: Programs to reduce deadly violence, including specific recommendations for strategies to address homicides.

target.value: 2014:National plan to address homicides, with a focus on the death rate among black adolescents, drawn up with UNICEF

actual.value: 2016:2016 -UPDATE: The Youth Alive Plan has been converted on a federal program against homicides, led by the National Secretariat of Youth, Presidency of the Republic. The program counts with permanent technical support from UNICEF, as the issue remain a priority for the next CPD.

title.narrative: Existence of a plan of the Brazilian Judiciary to promote and protect the rights of children and adolescents, in line with the Ten-Year Plan.

baseline.value: Ten-Year Plan for promoting and protecting children

target.value: 2012:Judiciary Plan approved and aligned with the Ten-Year Plan

actual.value: 2016:Plan of Action of the Brazilian Judiciary to protect and defend the rights of children adopted.

title.narrative: Existence of free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements

actual.value: 2016:National registration services are universal, free and in accordance with national legal requirements.

title.narrative: for the PAM region - percentage of municipalities taking part in the Seal project in the PAM region with civil registration professionals or members of guardianship councils trained on the importance of registering the birth of indigenous and Quilombola children, paying attention to their cultural specificities.

baseline.value: for the PAM region: Situation in 2012 - survey under way. Primer being prepared for training purposes and for raising awareness on the need to register the birth of indigenous children.

actual.value: 2016:81% (240 municipalities out of 294 that completed all phases of UNICEF Seal initiative) taking part in all phases of the Seal methodology participated with at least one professional of the birth registration teams or member of a guardianship council.

title.narrative: for the PAM region - Percentage of municipalities taking part in the Seal project in the PAM region with civil registration professionals or members of guardianship councils trained on the importance of registering the birth of indigenous and Quilombola children, paying attention to their cultural specificities.

baseline.value: for the PAM region: Situation in 2012 - survey under way. Primer being prepared for training purposes and for raising awareness on the need to register the birth of indigenous children.

target.value: 2015:for the PAM region: 80% of all municipalities taking part in the UNICEF Seal project in the PAM region with at least one professional of the birth registration teams or member of a guardianship counsi

actual.value: 2016:81% (240 municipalities) out of 294 took part in all phases of the Seal methodology participated with at least one professional of the birth registration teams or member of a guardianship council.) UPDATE: 219 (74%) municipalities (219/294) that completed all phases in the SELO in the Amazon region

title.narrative: for the SAB region - Percentage of Interconnected Units (maternity wards and hospital centres) provided with an online birth registration system.

baseline.value: for the SAB region: Interconnected Units accounting for 26.8% of the total figure of 413 maternity wards and hospital centres.

target.value: 2016:for the SAB region: 60% of units interconnected (maternity wards and hospital centres).

actual.value: 2016:Latest data collected by UNICEF:28.16% (245 of all 870 interconnected units). Latest information points to closing of interconnected units, instead of its expansion. Constraints:Results are below the target set as state level governments are currently not able to fund the establishment of intercon

title.narrative: Existence of public and civil society initiatives (policies, programmes, projects, including in the IEC context) drawn up with the support from UNICEF to protect children in the context of large civil construction projects and sporting events.

actual.value: 2016:SAB: Bahia - During the 2016 Olympic Games, the Local Committee for the Protection of Children in Major Sporting Events of Bahia, held social mobilization initiatives against sexual exploitation and child labor.
